name: Yiming Zhang 0003
content: Yiming Zhang's academic Homepage Yiming Zhang Professor, Director of NICE Lab, SJTU & XMU, China E-mail: zhangyiming at cs dot sjtu dot edu dot cn; zhangyiming at xmu dot edu dot cn Dr. Yiming Zhang is a professor at SJTU and XMU. He is also the director of the NICE Lab (Laboratory of Networked Intelligent Computing at Exascale). His research is focused on operating, networking, storage, and AI systems. As the first/corresponding author, he has published many highly-influential papers in top conferences like NSDI, FAST and EuroSys, and famous Journals like TOCS, TOS and TON. He is an associate editor of IEEE Transactions on Computers and IEEE Transactions on Services Computing, and a member of 2022 EuroSys Roger Needham Award Committee. He has received the Best Paper Award of USENIX FAST'23, the National Science and Technology Award (2nd prize), the Natural Science Award of Hunan province (1st prize), and the (top 10) Outstanding Dissertation Award. His research (TianheGraph) is ranked No. 1 in the latest Graph500 on Tianhe supercomputer. As the team leader, he won the CCF Award of Science and Technology (1st prize) in 2021. Here is the CV.
